ingredients.i1: 2 pounds salmon fillet, cut in half
ingredients.i5: 1/4 teaspoon ground pepper, or to taste

cooking_method.s2: Place salmon into baking dish, skin down.
cooking_method.s4: Sprinkle with dried basil, salt and pepper.
cooking_method.s6: Cover tightly with foil. Bake 30-40 minutes, until flaky and pale pink inside (test with fork), serve hot.

ingredients.i5: 3 large Bramley cooking apples, chopped, stewed and cooled

cooking_method.s2: Sieve the flour and salt into a bowl.
cooking_method.s3: Mix in the margarine or butter until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs.
cooking_method.s4: Add the cold water to the flour mixture. Using a knife, mix the water into the flour, using your hand to firm up the mixture. The pastry should be of an even colour and suitable consistency for rolling.
cooking_method.s5: Divide the pastry into two halves. Take one half and roll it out so that it is big enough to cover an 20cm/8in enamel or aluminium plate. Trim the edges with a knife using the edge of the plate as your guide.
cooking_method.s6: Cover the pastry with the stewed apples and sprinkle with sugar to taste.
cooking_method.s7: Roll out the other half of the pastry. Moisten the edge of the bottom layer of pastry and place the second piece on top.
cooking_method.s8: Press down on the pastry edges, making sure that they are properly sealed. Trim off any excess pastry with a knife in a downward motion, again using the plate as your guide.
cooking_method.s9: Flute the edges with a pinching action using your fingers and thumb.
cooking_method.s10: Prick the surface of the pastry lightly before placing the pie in the oven. Cook for 20-30 minutes.
cooking_method.s11: Slide on to a serving plate, dust with caster sugar and serve.

ingredients.i2: 200g/7oz streaky bacon or lean back-bacon, rind removed, finely chopped
ingredients.i3: 2 large carrots, peeled and roughly chopped
ingredients.i6: 2 potatoes, such as Maris Peer potatoes, roughly chopped
ingredients.i12: 1 handful fresh flatleaf parsley, leaves finely chopped

cooking_method.s1: Heat the oil in a large saucepan over a medium heat. Add the bacon and fry for 2-3 minutes, or until cooked and starting to brown.
cooking_method.s2: Add the carrots, garlic and onions and fry for 4-5 minutes.
cooking_method.s3: Add the potatoes and fry for 4-5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until softened.
cooking_method.s4: Stir in the tomato purée and cook for 1 minute, then add the tomatoes, bouquet garni and stock and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat, then simmer gently for 30 minutes.
cooking_method.s5: Add the courgettes and soup pasta and return to the boil. Reduce the heat, cover the pan with the lid, then simmer for 5-8 minutes, or until the pasta is tender.
cooking_method.s7: To serve, ladle the soup into bowls, then sprinkle over the parsley and Parmesan.

ingredients.i1: 2.75kg/6lb 2oz whole beef sirloin, fat and sinew trimmed

cooking_method.s1: Prepare the beef. Preheat the oven to 200C/180C Fan/Gas 6.
cooking_method.s2: Score the fat of the beef in a criss-cross pattern using a sharp knife, then season the beef generously with salt and pepper.
cooking_method.s3: Heat a frying pan over a high heat. When the pan is very hot, add 25g/1oz of the beef dripping and, when it has melted, fry the beef on all sides until browned all over.
cooking_method.s4: Place the beef joint, fat side facing downwards, into a roasting tray and roast for 45-50 minutes (for medium-rare) or longer until cooked to your liking – although bear in mind that the meat will continue to cook as it rests. Turn the beef joint halfway through the cooking time.
cooking_method.s5: When the beef is cooked to your liking, transfer it to a large plate, cover with aluminium foil and set aside to rest for 30 minutes.
cooking_method.s6: Serve the beef on a platter, surrounded by roast potatoes on one side and Brussels sprouts on the other. Serve vegetables on a separate platter and add sauce in a gravy boat.

cooking_method.s2: Bake the pastry case for 15 minutes until firm and browned slightly.
cooking_method.s3: Remove the case and turn the oven down to 160C/325F/Gas 3.
cooking_method.s4: In a medium saucepan, bring the milk and cream nearly to the boil.
cooking_method.s5: Beat the eggs, yolks and sugar together in a bowl.
cooking_method.s6: Pour the hot milk over them and beat gently.
cooking_method.s7: Pour the mixture into the pastry case and grate a little nutmeg on top.
cooking_method.s8: Bake for 40 minutes until just set. Remove from the oven and leave to cool before serving.
